That, through which a pactum is also a contram, is usually called its causa civilis, and of such causae civiles there are four, viz. (1) res, delivery of ownership, possession or detention of an object hythe creditor, whence the four Real Contracts. (2) The expression of the agreement in a certain verbal form (obligatio verborum), that of question and answer (stipulatio) being regarded as the verbal contract par excellence.
